Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Oppositional/defiant disorder or conduct disorder (ODD or CD)

Since you started our research study, have you been taking any medications prescribed by a doctor or nurse practitioner for substance abuse (e.g., Antabuse, naltrexone, methadone, buprenorphine, etc.)
(if yes) Since you started our research study, did you have any changes in your prescribed medications for substance abuse?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, added a new medication or increased the dose of an existing medication; 2= Yes, discontinued a medication or decreased the dose of an existing medication

ElementDescription: Since you started in our research study, please indicate what best describes your average involvement in support groups, such as Alcoholics Anonymous and Narcotics Anonymous?
Notes: 0= None; 1= Less than Once a Month; 2= Once a Month; 3= Every Other Week; 4= Once a Week; 5= Twice a Week; 6= Mora than twice a week

ElementDescription: Since you started in our research study, please indicate what best describes your average involvement in individual therapy.
Notes: 0= None; 1= Less than Once a Month; 2= Once a Month; 3= Every Other Week; 4= Once a Week; 5= Twice a Week; 6= Mora than twice a week; 7= New to Mental Health Treatment

ElementDescription: (If any individual therapy) Since you started in our research study, what types of issues were you addressing in individual therapy?
Notes: 1= Mental Health; 2= Substance Abuse; 3= Both Mental Health and Substance Abuse

ElementDescription: Since you started in our research study, please indicate what best describes your average involvement in group therapy.
Notes: 0= None; 1= Less than Once a Month; 2= Once a Month; 3= Every Other Week; 4= Once a Week; 5= Twice a Week; 6= Mora than twice a week; 7= New to Mental Health Treatment

ElementDescription: (if any group therapy) Since you started in our research study, what types of issues were you addressing in group therapy?
Notes: 1= Mental Health; 2= Substance Abuse; 3= Both Mental Health and Substance Abuse

ElementDescription: Since you started in our research study, have you been taking any medications prescribed by a doctor or nurse practitioner for mental health difficulties other than substance abuse (e.g., anxiety, sleep problems, depression, posttraumatic stress disorder)?
(if yes) Since you started in our research study, did you have any changes in your prescribed medications for mental health difficulties other than substance abuse?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, added a new medication or increased the dose of an existing medication; 2= Yes, discontinued a medication or decreased the dose of an existing medication

ElementDescription: Compared to another person of your age, would you say your health is:
Notes: 1= Worse than others; 2= Same as others; 3= Better than others; 998= Do Not Know; 999= No Answer

ElementDescription: How often in the past one month were you unable to do the work you usually do because of an emotional or psychological problem?
How often in the past one month did you have to lie in bed for more than half a day because because of an emotional or psychological problem?
During the past month, how much difficulty did you have in taking care of your household responsibilities because of an emotional or psychological problem?
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= A Little; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Extremely; 998= Do Not Know; 999= No Answer

ElementDescription: In general would you say your physical health is:
Notes: 1 = Excellent; 2 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 4 = Fair; 5 = Poor

ElementDescription: In general would you say your mental health is:
Notes: 1 = Excellent; 2 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 4 = Fair; 5 = Poor

ElementDescription: How would you rate your overall life satisfaction and contentment during the past week?
Notes: 1 = Very Good; 2 = Good; 3 = Fair; 4 = Poor; 5 = Very Poor

ElementDescription: On a ten point scale, where 0 is not at all and 10 is extremely, to what extent have symptoms of depression disrupted your WORK in the last week?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 10 = Extremely; -888 = N/A, Not working

ElementDescription: On a ten point scale, where 0 is not at all and 10 is extremely, to what extent have symptoms of depression disrupted your SOCIAL LIFE OR LEISURE ACTIVITIES in the last week?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 10 = Extremely; -888 = Not applicable

ElementDescription: On a ten point scale, where 0 is not at all and 10 is extremely, to what extent have symptoms of depression disrupted your FAMILY LIFE OR HOME RESPONSIBILITIES in the last week?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 10 = Extremely; -888 = Not applicable
